post.body: Just testing. Looking for something without censure after I got banned for 7 days in Facebook for this pic.

I keep getting error "TorManager Disabling Tor, because error while accessing Tor proxy at port 127.0.0.1:9150: No connection" despite that I have Tor proxy always running on 9150 and I have added control port and cookie auth in tor config file and it all seems to be working ok when I check it. My ISP have some kind of restriction or misconfiguration may be, so p2p does not work well, I usually can't even connect to torrent peers. But it works with sock5 tor proxy. ZeroNet, however, does not for some reason.

Unbelievable. I wrote a post on Facebook about zeronet as possible, but regrettably feature-poor alternative to it (p2p solutions simply can't do many things that centralized can) and Facebook auto-deleted my post because it contained a reference to zeronet and "it is against community guidelines". Shitbags. I could not even imagine they could stoop this low.

This is in Britain. I wonder if those people know that in USSR, whose flag and symbolic they wear, consensual gay sex was a criminal offense with a punishment of 3 to 5 years of prison camps if discovered. And if you openly admitted you like other men they would send you to mental hospital where you would be literally tortured with Sulfozinum injections.

Yoshiko Okada was a Japanese film and stage actress who was most famous for her defection to the Soviet Union.  On 3 January 1938, Okada defected to the Soviet Union with her lover Ry≈çkichi Sugimoto, seeking freedom from the militaristic regime of Imperial Japan and hoping to study theater with other Japanese in the USSR. Sugimoto, however, was arrested and executed as a spy and Okada spent the next ten years in a prison camp.
Another ban from Facebook. This one is really something.

comment.body: @1bfqutudhtexlka: It gets stranger. I downloaded tor browser to check if it works (have not been using it for a while) and after I launched tor browser and it worked, I restarted ZeroNet (opens in FireFox not in tor browser) and it connected to 9150 without any problems, like launching tor browser has opened something.

@1bfqutudhtexlka: I just verified, that if I don't have tor browser running at the moment I start ZeroNet it can't connect to tor proxy, despite that the tor proxy itself always runs in my system. If I close tor browser after I started ZeroNet it seems to keep working with tor, at least it shows green "Tor: Available" icon.
@1bfqutudhtexlka: I understand the conception behind distributed p2p networks, but the main question is - what happens if my system crashes and I lose all local files.
@nekololi: I don't post anything illegal anyway, but Facebook is getting ridiculous recently. I suppose there is a way to change the hub later in case I don't like the current one for some reason?

@Halo1117: I think it will never be popular with general public because it's too complicated and inconvenient for them. at best it can become a network for marginals. This is still a better alternative than no alternative at all.
